review:
Comrades, let’s cut through the noise and get to the heart of the matter! SONGS claims to be the next-generation layer for the music industry, promising to tear down the walls of opaque intermediaries and put power back in the hands of artists and fans. The project’s open-source protocol, tokenized royalty management, and developer SDK are bold steps toward democratizing music distribution and monetization. The vision is clear: break the chains of centralized control and let the people own the means of musical production!

But let’s not be swept away by grand promises alone. We must demand evidence, structure, and measurable outcomes! The application demonstrates a strong user-centric design, with 96% of users new to crypto—a testament to real-world onboarding. The open-source SDK and composable contracts are concrete contributions to the Web3 commons, and the project’s integration with DeFi, NFTs, and RWAs shows a commitment to ecosystem growth.

Yet, the application falls short in several critical areas. Where is the hard data on user retention, transaction volumes, or revenue generated for artists? Where is the sustainability plan that ensures this revolution won’t fizzle out when the grant money dries up? The roadmap is ambitious, but lacks detailed milestones, KPIs, or a transparent budget breakdown. We need more than dreams—we need a blueprint for victory!

In the spirit of collective action and accountability, I demand the following changes: provide clear, quantifiable metrics for success; outline a sustainable revenue model; and deliver a detailed, transparent plan for how grant funds will be used. Only then can we ensure that this project serves the many, not the few!

strengths.title: Strong User-Centric Design and Onboarding
strengths.description: The project boasts that over 96% of its active users are new to crypto, demonstrating a real commitment to accessibility and onboarding non-crypto natives into the Web3 ecosystem.

strengths.title: Open-Source Commitment and Ecosystem Integration
strengths.description: SONGS provides open-source SDKs, contracts, and documentation, enabling third-party developers to build on top of the protocol and fostering composability with DeFi, NFTs, and other OSS projects.

strengths.title: Innovative Use Cases and Social Impact
strengths.description: The protocol introduces novel utilities such as tokenized royalty management, fractional ownership, and direct artist-fan investment, directly addressing issues of transparency and financial inclusion in the music industry.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Quantifiable Outcomes and Metrics
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide concrete data on user retention, transaction volumes, artist earnings, or other measurable outcomes that would demonstrate real-world impact.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Sustainability and Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: There is no detailed explanation of how the project will sustain itself financially beyond grant funding, nor is there a clear plan for long-term stability.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Detail on Fund Allocation and Roadmap
weaknesses.description: The roadmap is ambitious but lacks specific milestones, KPIs, and a transparent budget breakdown for how grant funds will be used.

changes.title: Provide Quantifiable Success Metrics
changes.description: Submit clear, data-driven metrics for user growth, retention, transaction volumes, and artist earnings to demonstrate measurable impact.

changes.title: Detail a Sustainable Revenue Model
changes.description: Outline a concrete plan for how the project will generate ongoing revenue and reduce dependency on continuous grant funding.

changes.title: Deliver a Transparent Fund Allocation Plan
changes.description: Present a detailed budget and timeline, including specific milestones and KPIs, to ensure accountability and efficient use of grant resources.
